Story scope

Introducing Vendor compare view into policy 360.


	Visualize the relationship between PlainID policies and their vendor-native counterparts
	Gain transparency into policy synchronization status between plainid and the vendor
	Streamline authoring workflows by exposing side-by-side comparisons in vendor language within the Authorization Workspace
	Enable reconciliation operations such as policy deployment and override - all from a single, unified view



Detailed requirements

https://plainid.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PM/pages/4483022849/Policy+360+-+Vendor+Compare+View 


Shadow policies - detailed as part of 4.11 is not in scope for that story will be implemented in a designated story


FE Notes

list of functionalities which can be completed at the end:


	change order using drag and drop
	zoom in out and pinch
	Policy diff view will not open on a full screen - side menu will still be visible (unlike figma)



Acceptance criteria


	behavior validated on both new and existing POPs from different vendors
	behavior validated for different types of policies (masking, row, general)
	behavior validated for use cases when multiple platform policy are connected to single vendor policy
	behavior validated with large amount of polices in the display
	Updated behavior and terminology for audit and permissions validated
	Update pop details (including order) via UI or PAC works as expected
	no regression for flags, reconciliation actions, schedualer, etc'
	No regression for policies used for dynamic authorization service

test_cases.title: Verify navigation to Vendor Compare View from Authorization Workspace
test_cases.description: Ensure users can navigate to the Vendor Compare View from the Policies tab in the Authorization Workspace.
test_cases.preconditions: User is logged into PlainID and has access to the Authorization Workspace.

steps.action: Navigate to Authorization Workspace → Policies menu → Click on Vendor Compare View
steps.expected_result: Vendor Compare View opens displaying relevant policies and assets.
steps.test_data: User has access to the Authorization Workspace.

test_cases.expected_result: User successfully navigates to the Vendor Compare View without errors.

test_cases.title: Verify vendor policy selection reveals connected platform policies
test_cases.description: Validate that when a vendor policy is selected, all linked platform policies are displayed correctly in Vendor Compare View.
test_cases.preconditions: Vendor policy exists with connected platform policies in the system.

steps.expected_result: User sees the selected vendor policy highlighted in the interface.

steps.action: Select vendor policy in the Vendor Compare View
steps.expected_result: All linked platform policies to the selected vendor policy are displayed correctly.

test_cases.expected_result: The display updates to show all connected platform policies for the selected vendor policy.

test_cases.title: Verify policy synchronization status is displayed correctly
test_cases.description: Ensure that the Vendor Compare View accurately shows the synchronization status of policies between PlainID and the vendor.
test_cases.preconditions: Vendor policies exist and have synchronization statuses defined in the system.

steps.expected_result: User sees synchronization status indicators next to each policy.

test_cases.expected_result: All policies show correct synchronization status, including indicators for discrepancies or pending actions.

test_cases.title: Verify policy deployment from Vendor Compare View
test_cases.description: Validate that users can deploy policies directly from the Vendor Compare View to the vendor system.
test_cases.preconditions: Vendor policy is selected, and the user has required permissions to perform deployments.

steps.action: Select vendor policy in Vendor Compare View
steps.expected_result: Vendor policy details are displayed along with deployment options.
API call is initiated to deploy the policy to the vendor.

test_cases.expected_result: Deployment is processed successfully, and user receives confirmation of deployment.

test_cases.title: Verify drag-and-drop reordering of policies works correctly
test_cases.description: Ensure that users can reorder policies using drag-and-drop functionality in the Vendor Compare View.
test_cases.preconditions: Multiple vendor policies are displayed in the Vendor Compare View.

steps.expected_result: Users can see vendor policies displayed in a list format.
steps.test_data: User has access to Vendor Compare View.

steps.action: Drag a policy to a new position in the list
steps.expected_result: The policy moves to the new position and updates the order correctly in the backend.

test_cases.expected_result: Policies are reordered correctly, with new order reflecting in the system and UI.

test_cases.title: Verify pinch and zoom functionality in Vendor Compare View
test_cases.description: Ensure that users can pinch to zoom in and out within the Vendor Compare View for improved visibility.
test_cases.preconditions: User is viewing the Vendor Compare View with multiple policies displayed.

steps.action: Open Vendor Compare View with multiple policies displayed
steps.expected_result: The view should be fully rendered with all policies visible.
steps.test_data: User has access to Vendor Compare View.

steps.expected_result: The Vendor Compare View zooms in/out correctly, maintaining the display of all elements.

test_cases.expected_result: View allows for pinch to zoom actions to enhance visibility of policies and assets.

test_cases.title: Verify functionality of selecting all assets in Vendor Compare View
test_cases.description: Validate that users can select all assets from the Vendor Compare View and see the associated policies.
test_cases.preconditions: Multiple assets are linked to policies displayed in the Vendor Compare View.

steps.action: Navigate to Vendor Compare View and select 'Select All' for assets
steps.expected_result: An option to select all assets appears, highlighting all associated assets in the view.

steps.action: Verify that all linked assets are highlighted
steps.expected_result: All linked assets should be visually marked in the UI, allowing for easy identification.
steps.test_data: All linked asset IDs are displayed.

test_cases.expected_result: All assets are selected and highlighted correctly in the Vendor Compare View, improving visibility for users.

test_cases.title: Verify audit logs for actions taken in Vendor Compare View
test_cases.description: Ensure that user actions in the Vendor Compare View are correctly logged in the audit system.
test_cases.preconditions: User performs actions such as deploying policies and selecting vendor policies in Vendor Compare View.

steps.action: Perform a deployment action in Vendor Compare View
steps.expected_result: The action is logged in the system's audit trail.

steps.action: Check audit logs for the deployment action
steps.expected_result: Audit logs show the deployment action executed by the user with relevant details.
steps.test_data: Audit event for user action should include parameters like timestamp, user ID, and action performed.

test_cases.expected_result: All actions taken in the Vendor Compare View are logged correctly in the audit system, with comprehensive details.

metadata.ai_reasoning:
This feature introduces a Vendor Compare View in PlainID's Policy 360°, which allows users to visualize the relationships between PlainID policies and their vendor-native counterparts. It addresses the problem of fragmented SaaS authorization management by providing deep visibility and control in a unified interface, streamlining workflows and reconciliation operations. Key PlainID components involved include the PAP (Policy Administration Point), POP (Policy Object Point), and various workspaces such as the Authorization Workspace and Orchestration Workspace.

Functionality to test includes:
- Navigation to the Vendor Compare View
- Display of connected platform policies when a vendor policy is selected
- Synchronization status between PlainID and vendor policies
- Correct display of asset types and their connections
- Policy deployment and override operations from the Vendor Compare View
- Behavior validation for multiple policy types (masking, row access, general)
- Handling of large volumes of policies
- UI interactions like drag-and-drop for policy ordering and zooming in/out.

### Acceptance Criteria Mapping
- AC1: behavior validated on both new and existing POPs from different vendors → Tests: "Verify behavior with existing vendor policies", "Verify behavior with new vendor policies"
- AC2: behavior validated for different types of policies (masking, row, general) → Tests: "Verify display for masking policies", "Verify display for row access policies"
- AC3: behavior validated for use cases when multiple platform policies are connected to single vendor policy → Tests: "Verify multiple platform policies for single vendor policy"
- AC4: behavior validated with large amount of policies in the display → Tests: "Verify system behavior with 100+ policies"
- AC5: Updated behavior and terminology for audit and permissions validated → Tests: "Verify audit logs for vendor compare actions"
- AC6: Update pop details (including order) via UI or PAC works as expected → Tests: "Verify updating POP details from Vendor Compare View"
- AC7: no regression for flags, reconciliation actions, schedualer, etc' → Tests: "Verify reconciliation flags are accurate"
- AC8: No regression for policies used for dynamic authorization service → Tests: "Verify dynamic authorization service policies remain unaffected" 

### Subtask Analysis
- **Selecting Vendor Policy**: Validate that selecting a vendor policy reveals connected platform policies.
- **Select all Assets**: Ensure functionality works for selecting all assets in the view.
- **Policies order**: Test drag-and-drop ordering of policies.
- **View controls implementation**: Validate pinch and zoom functionality.
- **Implement Vendor Policy edit**: Ensure vendor policy details can be edited as specified.
- **Policy indicators**: Verify that synchronization status indicators are displayed correctly.
- **Code compare tab implementation**: Confirm that the code compare functionality behaves as expected.
- **Audit Events view**: Ensure audit events are recorded as expected.

### What Can Break?
Integration points exist between the PAP, PDP, and the vendor systems, where synchronization issues could arise. If vendor policies are not correctly linked to PlainID policies, it may lead to display errors or incorrect entitlements. Testing needs to verify that all data flows correctly between components, particularly regarding policy overrides and deployments. Additionally, performance may degrade with larger policy sets, and UI behaviors should be tested under load.

summary: The tests verify the functionality and user experience of the Vendor Compare View in PlainID's Policy 360°, ensuring synchronization between PlainID and vendor-native policies, seamless reconciliation operations, and accurate display of policy relationships and indicators.
